com.tooltwist.domXml
Class DomXml

java.lang.Object
  com.tooltwist.domXml.DomXml
All Implemented Interfaces:
XSelector, Iterable<XSelector>
public class DomXml
extends Object
implements XSelector, Iterable<XSelector>

This class provides a XSelector implementation for accessing data stored in the form of the W3C Document Object Model (DOM). It also allows the DOM object to be manipulated, and the changes propagated throughout the XD form of the data.

 XD data = ...;
 DomXml domXml = (DomXml) data.getSelector("xml-dom");
 Document document = domXml.getDocument();
 // Do stuff with and to the document.
 domXml.notifyChanged();

This class also contains many methods for manipulating and merging data between XD, Element and Node objects.

Author:
philipcallender

getNodeListWithW3cXpath

public NodeList getNodeListWithW3cXpath(String xpath)
                                 throws XDException
Get a node that matches a specified DOM XPath.

This differs from getNodeList(String) in that it supports full W3C XPaths (see http://www.w3.org/TR/xpath/).

Note that W3C XPath indexes start with an index of one (e.g. "/data/country[1]").

Parameters:
xpath - An XPath to be matched.
Throws:
XDException

                            Node target)
                     throws XDException

Parameters:
path - A selection path to be matched.
target - The place from which to start the search.
Throws:
XDException
See Also:
select(String)

getNodeListWithW3cXpath

public NodeList getNodeListWithW3cXpath(String xpath,
                                        Node target)
                                 throws XDException
Get a node that matches a specified W3C XPath, below a specified starting point.

This differs from getNodeList(String, Node) in that it supports full W3C defined XPaths (see http://www.w3.org/TR/xpath/).

Note that W3C XPath indexes start with an index of one (e.g. "/data/country[1]").

Parameters:
xpath - An XPath to be matched.
target - A node within the document held by this DomXml.
Throws:
XDException

first

public void first()
This data type does not provide a list of records, so the next() method only returns true once.

To iterate over elements within this object, use select(String) or one of the foreach(String) methods.

Specified by:
first in interface XSelector

This data type does not provide a list of records, so this method only returns true until next() is called.

To iterate over elements within this object, use select(String) or one of the foreach(String) methods.

Return the name of the field currently selected. For example, if you used select("/* /customer") to get this XDSelector object, then the field name will be "customer".

next

public boolean next()
This data type does not provide a list of records, so this method only returns true one time. Actually it serves no purpose other than to allow iterators to access the data that can be accessed directly. For example, 
 FastXml data = ...;
 String value = data.string("./name");
will return exactly the same as: 
 FastXml data = ...;
 while (data.next()) {
   String value = data.string("./name");
 }

To iterate over a list of elements within this data object, use select(String) or one of the foreach(String) methods.

Specified by:
next in interface XSelector

select

public XSelector select(String path)
                 throws XDException
Description copied from interface: XSelector
Select a list. For example: 
 XData data = ...;
 XDSelector list = data.select("/* /product");
 while (list.next()) {
        String description = list.string("description");
 }

select in interface XSelector

public void foreach(String path,
                    Object userData,

             throws XDException
Description copied from interface: XSelector
Iterate through matching items using a callback object to handle each item. For example: 
 XData data = ...;
 MyData myData = ...;
 data.select("/* /product", myData, new XDCallback() {
   @Override 
   public void next(IXData item, int index, Object data) throws XDataNotFoundException, XDataException {
     MyData myData = (MyData) data;
           String description = item.string("description");
   }
 });

 XData data = ...;

getString

public static String getString(Node elem)
Recursively get the text within a specified DOM node. This method does not return XML - it returns all the text within the node and it's children.

Parameters:
elem - The specified element or node within a DOM document.
Returns:
The text within the node.

createChild

public static void createChild(Element parent,
                               Node childNode)
Insert a node under an existing node.

Parameters:
parent - The DOM node under which the new node should be created.
name - The tag for the new node.
value - The value of the new node.

createChild

public static void createChild(Element parent,
                               String tag,
                               String value)
Insert a new text node under an existing node. Example
The following code demonstrates the use of createChild.
String xml =
"<product>" +
"    <code>HAM01</code>" +
"    <description>A large hammer</description>" +
"</product>";
XData data = new XData(xml);
Node productNode = data.getXpathNode("/product", 0);
XData.createChild(productNode, "cost", "$12.50");
logger.debug(data.getXml());
Output:
<product>
    <code>HAM01</code>
    <description>A large hammer</description>
    <cost>$12.50</cost>
</product>

Parameters:
parent - The DOM node under which the new node should be created.
name - The tag for the new node.
value - The value of the new node.

getChildValue

                                   String name)
Get the value of tag directly below a specified DOM element within a DOM document.

Parameters:
elem - The parent DOM element or node.
name - The tag of the required node.
Returns:
A string containing XML data.

public Node getNode(String path,

             throws XDException
Get a node that matches a specified selection path.

This method returns the index'th node that matches the provided XPath. If no suitable node can be found, return null.

path - An selection path to be matched.
index - Which node to return.
Returns:

insert

public void insert(String path,
                   XD xd)
            throws XDException

path - The selection path for the node under which the document will be added.

Throws:
XDException

sortElements

public void sortElements(String parentPath,
                         String elementName,
                         String sortFields,
                         boolean isAscending)
                  throws XDException
Sort elements within the data.

Note that this method will force conversion to 'xml-dom', with the associated cost of parsing, etc.

Parameters:
parentPath - Defines the immediate parent of the records to be sorted.
elementName - The name of the elements to be sorted.
sortFields - A list of fields within the element that will be used to determine the ordering, separated by semicolons. A '#' before a field name indicates that it should be treated as numeric.
isAscending - Sort in increasing or decreasing order.
Throws:
XDException

                 throws XDException
